Joining me now, the head of the Senate Judiciary Committee, Lindsey Graham. All right, senator, on the theme of repercussions, in both of these cases, can we expect the DOJ's full involvement?

utterances.speaker: SEN. LINDSEY GRAHAM, R-S.C.
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think so. I think Bill Barr is a man of the Department of Justice. This has been his life's work, and I think he's very disappointed and concerned by the way the FBI handled the FISA warrant application, the counterintelligence investigation, and he's going to be very supportive of looking to find out how this got off the rails.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: A lot of folks when they approach me and I'm traveling around the country, I'm sure you get the same thing. People say how do Hillary's people, how do they manage to smash BlackBerrys, how do they unmask all of these Americans with probably for dubious reasons. How is the U.N. ambassador unmasking, like Samantha Power, how is this all happening? There's never any repercussions. What do you say to them just on that score?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: One, let's find somebody to prove that it did happen we all trust. You know Mueller, I stood behind him because I thought he was a fair guy. A lot of people on our side thought he was on a witch hunt. I didn't, quite frankly. But the president has been vindicated. Let's take somebody like Mueller to ask these questions. Did they get a FISA warrant by using compromised, bogus information?

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: They did, didn't they?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I think so, but let somebody other than Lindsey Graham and Laura Ingraham say it. Let's find somebody of the stature of Mueller to look at the other side of the story, because if they find something, I want to believe it's based on the evidence, not politics.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Is Bill Barr now looking into the possibility of appointing another special counsel?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I am urging him for one simple reason. This is an emotional event. Most Republicans believe they were out to get Trump. Most people think that Strzok and Page and McCabe and Comey wanted Clinton to win and Trump to lose, and they took the law into their own hands. If that's true, it's horrible. Let's find somebody that can tell us if it's true, take the appropriate action. I think it's very important to have a Mueller-like figure looking --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I know that you think that, but you've had conversations with Barr. I know you had dinner with him the other night. Is he approaching that decision? Is there a timetable in which he'll make that decision?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: That's a good question. I think he's going to look at what happened. And the question for him, should it be me and the professionals here inside the building, or should I get somebody outside the system. It's not a question of if he looks. It's how he looks.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, they are attacking him now. They are trashing his credibility on the left. They are saying that he's just a political actor, that Mueller shouldn't have trusted him to make that obstruction decision. I've never heard of someone who is a Bush attorney general -- everyone is elevating the Bushs now for a variety of reasons. But I've never heard anyone attack Bill Barr and his professionalism until the left got into their multiple stages of grief here.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So like Adam Schiff has become the new Oliver Stone of the House, there's nothing that will ever satisfy them. Bill Barr is one of the greatest people to ever serve in the Department of Justice, highly respected on both sides of the aisle until Trump got to be president. The point I'm making is let's have somebody that maybe we can find, like a Mueller, to look at the other side.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Let's talk about a man who you probably wouldn't recommend take over this investigation, Jim Comey. He was on NBC tonight.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I think he's out.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He was last seen gazing up at the redwoods.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It looked like a lineup to me, Lindsey. Anyway, so he was on NBC tonight commenting. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: JAMES COMEY, FORMER FBI DIRECTOR
utterances.sentences: If there are questions that haven't been answered in the hours and hours and hours of testimony I've given, of course I'll answer them. I want it all done in the light of day, though. No more secretive positions. Public hearings serve the public interest. So if there are questions to be asked about how we handled this investigation or any other, let me know when you want me.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He's ready.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK, so one is going to be in public, and I'm going to give you a heads-up. One of the questions I'm going to ask, did Bruce Ohr tell you, you shouldn't trust Christopher Steele? And how much time and attention did you put into verifying the dossier before you certified to the court that it was reliable? So there you go. Think about it. Come to the committee here soon and you'll give me the answer in public. You will testify, my friend, in public, not behind closed doors, and you will answer for your time as FBI director.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Now, I want to get your take on another event that happened. One of your former colleagues, Senator Joe Biden. Now, he seems poised to launch a presidential bid, but like a lot of the Democrat candidates, he has to say that he's sorry about a lot of what he did. Here he's attempting to apologize for how Anita Hill, my old boss Clarence Thomas' confirmation hearings. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: They were a bunch of white guys. She faced a committee that didn't fully understand what the hell it was all about. To this day, I regret I couldn't come up with the way to get her the kind of hearing she deserved.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: He's a good guy. If he's not proud of the life he's lived, why should we make him president? If you really have to apologize for most of the things you've done your political life, why should we take you for being president?

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: But I think his comment is actually racially charged. When I say that, I think by saying if it's a panel of white men, you can't be fair. What is that? That's judging someone based on race. I thought we weren't supposed to do that.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: The problem is the party of Joe Biden is dead, and he's trying to find a way in the new party. In the new party, you have to apologize because if you are a white guy, you can't possibly be fair. This is what's going to undercut him, because I like Joe Biden. I like the real Joe Biden. I think he's been wrong on policy, but what he's doing now is putting in question whether or not he's authentic. Do you really believe he thinks that this apology is sincere? Is he just trying to position himself for political advantage? I think he's apologizing to get an advantage in a crazy primary.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Lindsey Graham, it is so great to see you. Don't be a stranger.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I'll be back.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Thanks for staying up late. Don't forget to vote in my Twitter poll. Who is the biggest threat to the United States? Is it Russia or is it China or North Korea? We are going to reveal the results in just moments.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: As Maury Povich says, the results are in. I asked you who is the biggest threat to the United States, Russia, China, or North Korea. With nearly 33,000 votes in over the last hour, you decided correctly. China is the biggest threat to the United States, 86 percent of the vote, Russia trailing with a paltry nine percent, North Korea, sorry, just five percent for you. That's all the time we have tonight. Remember, my new podcast dropped today. Trans-humanism, do you know what it is? You should, because it's coming. Subscribe at PodcastOne or just to go iTunes. utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: All right, this is “The Ingraham Angle” from Washington tonight. If you thought the last couple of nights were jam packed, wait until you see what we have for you tonight. Reaction to some of what the President just said. Newt Gingrich, Jim Jordan, Lindsey Graham, many more here to dig into that and the Left's continued denial over the results of the Mueller probe. Plus we have the latest on the Jussie Smollett case. Tonight, “The Ingraham Angle” investigates how Michelle Obama, Kamala Harris and George Soros may have been involved. Plus breaking news on how the FBI is now investigating the way prosecutors there handled the case. Raymond Arroyo is here. He'll break down all of the Hollywood latest buffoonery, hyperventilating over no collusion and the papal pulled back. What's that? A hilarious ‘Seen and Unseen' is ahead but first, the five stages of Democrat grief. That's the focus of tonight's “Angle.” Now this may seem strange to you. But I'm here tonight to counsel Democrats, to help them. Yes, you heard right, to help. Since the Mueller report was handed down, millions of liberals across America have been suffering from my profound sense of loss. These feelings at times seem overwhelming.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Read Ron, read.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: [Crying]

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: What did the bad man do?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: [Crying] I'm in a glass case of emotion.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, bless their hearts. After all, they have invested so much of themselves and their futures in Robert Mueller taking down the President. They named their dogs after him. They lit candles for him. They even wore his name, they venerated him. And they gave him thanks.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Thank you Robert Mueller and everyone working to make sure that we have sovereignty for the United States of America. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: You see, Mueller wasn't just a special prosecutor to Democrats, he was a deity, a messiah like figure who would deliver them from the evil of Trump. And wash away the sin of the 2016 election. Let's face it, even though built on rage, this was a religion for the Left. And now with the results in and Mr. Mueller returning to private life, leftists of all ages are asking themselves, who will replace him? What to look forward to now that it's all over? How to go back to normal life without the excitement of the investigation unfolding, day after day? What will fill the void? Well, recovery won't be easy I'm not going to lie to you because for Democrats, the end of this investigation is akin to the death of a loved one. They'll need to develop coping mechanisms and do a lot of interior work. Only then will the Trump haters be able to put their loss into perspective. And then move on. Authors David Kessler and Elizabeth Kubler Ross have written a number of books about coping with tragic loss. They broke it down into five stages. We see the Democrats and the Trump-haters working their way through the grieving process.

utterances.speaker: Stage One
utterances.utterance: Denial.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I don't know buy that he's completely exonerated, the way he just said.

utterances.speaker: LAURA COATES, FORMER FEDERAL PROSECUTOR
utterances.utterance: After two years, if you still have questions and you still can't answer that question, it's not good enough to say, well you decide whether or not he's actually committed a crime.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: This is the start of something apparently, not the end of something.

utterances.speaker: REP. MAXINE WATERS, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: There's so much that needs to be you know, taken a look at, at this point.

utterances.speaker: REP. ADAM SCHIFF, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: There is a big difference between whether there is evidence of collusion and I think that evidence is in plain sight.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And after denial, comes Stage Two: Anger.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Why was there never an interrogation of this President? How can they let Trump off the hook?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: In any other standard, the person would have been arrested, there would've been polygraph and they would have been put out or bought to trial.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There is not an African-American person in this country that could have been investigated for 22 months, had their family investigated for 22 months and come away scot free.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It feels like the seeds of a cover are here.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Let it all out. It's okay, we understand. You spent two years living in a fantasy world of her own making. After anger comes perhaps grief's most embarrassing stage where they try to convince themselves that up is down, black is white and Trump is guilty. It's called bargaining.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The Mueller report will ultimately get out and there will be very damaging information there for the President.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That was a finding and the government you know, Mueller did not exonerate this presidency.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We have to be careful about what we think that this says and it doesn't mean that Trump is free and clear.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, bargaining, that stage is sort of the last gasp of a dying fantasy. But the fact is Mueller did not find any evidence of much of the ballyhoo Trump collusion with Russia, it just didn't happen. I know it's hard. Which brings us to Stage Four: Depression.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This weekend we received some troubling news. Our President is not a Russian assets.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Obviously right now, we have mostly just a ton of questions as to what Mueller's report says, how complete it is, who gets to see it, who gets to decide who gets to see it and when?

utterances.speaker: VAN JONES, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: There is an honest level of sadness and disappointment and disorientation among progressives and Democrats and I think it goes deeper than just you know, what's in the report.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: As sad as it is, the next level of grief is perhaps the most important. Stage Five: Acceptance. And this is where liberals are in real trouble because for them there is no acceptance of the Mueller findings, there can't be. So they opt instead for vengeance.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: Attorney General Barr should be required to testify before the United States Congress under oath.

utterances.speaker: SEN. RICHARD BLUMENTHAL, D-CONN.
utterances.utterance: He should come before United States Congress. I do not deeply respect and trust the Starr summary.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I will certainly recommend that we bring Bob Mueller in to testify, that that we take it to court if necessary.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Okay, so many of them just will not accept this loss. But Rebecca Dudley certainly does. Remember, she was the woman who co-created this button and sold more than 48,000 of them to liberals all over the country. Who said faith was dead. She told The New York Times this week on the Mueller report that she knew there was no way anything could live up to two years of hype. So she's thinking of creating a new button to restore hope in the hearts of leftists everywhere. It'll read. STNY as in Southern District of New York which may take them all the way back to the first stage of grief. Denial and that's “The Angle.” All right, joining us now former House Speaker Newt Gingrich, a Fox News Contributor and host of a new podcast, it's fabulous called Newt's World. It's available on Apple podcast, and Congressman Jim Jordan, Ranking Member of the House Oversight Committee. Mr. Speaker, which stage of grief, do you think the liberals are in right now?

utterances.speaker: NEWT GINGRICH, FORMER SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE
utterances.utterance: Oh, I think that they're in denial. I think they'll be in denial until 2025. I think they'll get up every morning and think he can't still be there. It's not true. And I think that's why they're as nutty as thy are.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Congressman Jordan, this has been a wild week. I mean, you predicted much of this so did Newt so did I that this was a fantasy cooked up by false information. You see the Democrats really, they're in a struggle now, they're in a struggle with reality, struggle with their own base. Struggle with the fact that they devoted two years and they identified themselves with this religion of hating Trump.

utterances.speaker: REP. JIM JORDAN, R-OH
utterances.utterance: No, they - they - the Speaker's right, they are in denial because it was so strong what Bill Barr said about Bob Mueller's investigation. Remember the numbers, 19 - 40 - 500 - 2800. 19 lawyers, most of them Democrats. 40 FBI agents, 500 search warrants and 2800 subpoenas and what were the conclusions. No new indictment, no sealed indictments, no collusion, no obstruction, it could not be more definitive and so the two years of hype they build up based on this whole false dossier narrative that started the whole thing now comes kind of crashing down and so what are they going to do because they're in denial, they're going to launch a whole bunch of new investigations and they will not accept what the Special Counsel said to the Attorney General.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Maybe it's like Newt, when you find out that maybe the Easter bunny really isn't going to hop into their house and drop. Maybe it's a little more complicated than that, it's a little sense of disappointment but the President tonight spoke out in that interview with Sean Hannity. He talked specifically about what Congressman Jordan was alluding to, what was going on at the FBI, let's watch.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP (on phone)
utterances.utterance: Schiff is a bad guy because he knew he was lying. I mean, he's not a dummy and he knew he was lying and for a year and a half, he'd go on and just lie and lie and leak and call up CNN and others. He should be forced out of office. He is a disgrace to our country. You had dirty cops, he had people that are bad FBI folks. I know so many, they're incredible people but at the top, they were not clean to put it mildly and what they did to our country was a terrible - terrible thing.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Schiff, the FBI, hit both pretty hard.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: Okay, I think that there are three big investigations coming out of this. One is the deep state effort to really have a coup d'etat. I mean, you had from Obama, all the way down and Joe Biden's going to have an interesting problem because he was Vice President during this. Now was--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes, play this out. We want to really understand what you're saying.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: Well, look, it was Biden's so out of the loop, they had no idea what's was going on, in which case he looks kind of weird or did Biden know and not say anything but it's very clear during the last phase of the Obama presidency, they were actively working. I mean, I think, the point the President made in other part of this evening where he talked about Attorney General Lynch meeting with Bill Clinton. We got to get both of them under - under oath and then I'm hoping that Lindsey Graham is going to be very thorough. So one investigation is what happened in the effort to destroy Trump. The second investigation is since it's exactly the same people--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: - what happened in the effort to protect Hillary and the third frankly, I've been urging the news media to create their own Special Commission because under freedom of the press, I don't think it's a government function but I think the New York Times, The Washington Post should return their Pulitzer prizes for fall - clearly for fake news.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Oh my Gosh, that's a complete fraud perpetrated on the Pulitzer committee.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: And then we ought to find out, we got to have news people look at how - how did they get to be this sick.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And Congressman Jordan, I forgot to add one other stage of dealing with grief, confusion. Okay, tonight in an interview with the NBC, fired FBI director Jim Comey seemed to be suffering from confusion, let's watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Were you convinced in your mind that there was a strong possibility that this campaign, this presidential candidate at the time was colluding with Russia?

utterances.speaker: JIM COMEY, FORMER FBI DIRECTOR
utterances.utterance: I really didn't know. There was smoke and enough smoke to justify investigating.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: What are your questions?

utterances.speaker: COMEY
utterances.utterance: The obstruction piece confuses me. The purpose of the Special Counsel is to make sure that the politicals in this case, the Attorney General doesn't make the ultimate call.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: He's confused by Mueller not concluding that the President obstructed justice when the element of being an underlying climb wasn't there.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: We've been confused by Jim Comey's comments for a couple years now, the way he handled the Clinton investigation and the things he did which were unprecedented. That's why he was fired. Andy McCabe, the Deputy Director fired like three times under oath. Jim Baker demoted, left the FBI, under investigation by the Justice Department. Lisa Page, demoted, left the FBI.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Can you do this backwards by the way? Can you do what you just did--

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: Peter Strzok, Deputy Head of Counter Intelligence, demoted then fired. As the Speaker said, these are the same people who ran the Clinton investigation and then launched the Russia investigation. You know, why - we know it was so biased, look at the names they gave each investigation. What do they call the Clinton investigation? The mid-year exam. What do they call the Trump-Russia investigation? Crossfire Hurricane. You can almost see them pound their chests as they name the things.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: They're like crossword clues here.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: The bias was there from the start.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I didn't even know that.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: And the one thing I would add in this is because exactly what the Speaker said, never forget what Chuck Schumer said on January 6th 2017 President-elect Trump. He said you mess with the intelligence community, they have six ways from Sunday at getting back at you. That is scary, that is not supposed to work that way in this country. What are they going to get back at President for? For winning an election for goodness sake? So that is what is so wrong and that's why we have to do the investigation.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: It has to be but Newt, you and I talked have talked about this before. Repercussions for this bad behavior of government actors with an enormous amount of power, they - I'm so sick of the phrase, weaponized but they used the entire intelligence apparatus as a cudgel against various people, the President being the biggest target. But a lot of other people were taken down in the process, a lot of other people suffered, they couldn't pay their kid's tuition bills as we heard from Mike Caputo yesterday.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: You know one of the things that Lindsey Graham ought to do as Chairman of Judiciary committee.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: We're going to talk to him in a few minutes. It is - he ought to go out and ask everybody who was approached, how much did you have to spend - I talked to a person last night who was utterly totally innocent, he's like a bystander at a car wreck, cost $1.2 million to have done nothing. I mean--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: It's a complete outrage.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: And I think we'll find is probably a half billion dollars, you know cost to the citizens of United States to protect themselves from their own government.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: But I don't think like - when you think of people like Samantha Power, you think of Ben Rhodes, this whole crowd in the Clinton, they're still - Ben is still going on TV.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Still talking about how this is all - this all stinks to high heaven.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: You can go back to Susan Rice who went on this show and said all kinds of wrong things about the whole - you can just goes on and on and it's scary and what bothers Americans most is the double standard. One set of rules for regular people, people I get the privilege of representing. A different set if your name is Clinton, Comey, Lynch, Learner and that is never supposed to be how it works in our great country.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: What about the Democrat party today, Newt? I know - I tried to give them a little counseling but what do you think they can do now? I mean, they've gotten themselves in a bit of a trick box and I'm not going to you know, get all cocky about this how they can't ever recover but they really are in a bit of a bind here. With their base, with the leftists in their party now, what do they do?

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: Well, I mean they - look, they have a real dilemma that I think you probably wouldn't totally agree with. In a way, being totally crazy about this may be less destructive than getting quiet and letting us see who they really are. I was approached by a reporter this morning. Think about this.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I think, I see.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: I was approached by a reporter this morning who said, what did I think about Nancy Pelosi's effort to move the party toward the centre and talk down the Left wing. And I said that's baloney. I said, Pelosi is the leader of the semi-crazy wing of the party, trying to calm down the really crazy wing of the party. But the semi crazy wing now, if you look at the presidential candidates, they're for infanticide, they're for abolishing all private insurance, they're for 70% tax rates, they're for eliminating all fossil fuels. You get on the list what these people are already for you know, they're now seriously talking about reparations.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.utterance: Non-citizens voting.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: Non-citizens--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So we can go down the list.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: By the way, that is the mildly crazy wing, that's not the crazy- crazy wing. So in a sense, the Democrats right now be getting saved because they just look really stupid, lying about Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes, so the Mueller obsession in a way was better because it obscured the rest of this stuff.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Now the rest - now it's kind of the rest of the stuff's gone. Now Congressman, the Democrats also seem like they will maybe don't want to learn any lessons from Mueller.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: We see investigations going on literally from coast to coast.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Why doesn't he release his tax returns?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: What we need to do is to follow the evidence, continue to investigate.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And it's going to be the inauguration Trump real estate deals going back, apparently 27-28 years, et cetera, et cetera.

utterances.speaker: Jordan
utterances.utterance: Chairman Cummings sent a letter to the President when he was a private citizen, his accounting firm, for the last ten years, this is craziness but this is how determined they are. They are so focused on stopping the President instead of doing things that will actually help-

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: But Newt's theory is interesting though maybe Newt, that really is because when you start letting Ocasio-Cortez and the rest of the crowd talk about policy and you have to kind of do this jujitsu thing with her, then you have to like, whoa, I have to defend this stuff.

utterances.speaker: GINGRICH
utterances.utterance: Look, if you're a normal Democrat--
